Jupiter is the largest planet in the solar system.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world, but not the tallest. That title goes to Mauna Kea in Hawaii, which is mostly underwater but has a total height of over 10,000 metres.
Some deaf people are known to sleeptalk in sign language.
The speed of light is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
The largest desert in the world is NOT the Sahara... it's Antarctica! There is so little rain that it's considered a desert.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
